title: Rules, Games and Cheating
author: Aleksandr
description: A Socratic dialogue exploring what defines cheating, fairness, and value in games—especially when the 'players' include AI. The piece raises layered questions about consent, recognition, and the evolving boundaries of play.
summary: A brief yet thoughtful piece that quietly questions the implicit rules of play—especially as AI joins the game. What counts as cheating when the rules are fluid and the players may not be human?
